intro: Senecio campii, commonly known as the Cape snowflake, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are white to pale blue and bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Senecio campii is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental appeal.
